fields_of_interest: Humanitarian aid and civil protection, International co-operation and development, Employment and Social Affairs, Public Health, Migration and asylum, European Neighbourhood Policy
eu_initiatives: European Parliament as a whole, with representatives in the ENVI and Development Committee; Horizon Europe and R&D for new medicines, vaccines and diagnostics for tuberculosis; AMR resolutions. We also work directly with Parliamentary Assemblies such as Euronest and Eurolat
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
relevant_communication: The Global TB Caucus is the world’s biggest political network on a single issue. It has 2,300 members of parliament in 130 countries who work collectively and individually to accelerate the response against tuberculosis. The Global TB Caucus works to build the political will to end TB, a treatable and curable disease. The European Union is a crucial player in the fight against TB, including the work of MEPs and the Commission, both at the regional and national level.
goals__remit: The Global TB Caucus works to build the political will to end TB, a treatable and curable disease.
